Dear Dr Murrison,

I write, as a Hongkonger, to express my heartfelt gratitude at your reaffirmation on behalf of Her Majesty’s Government of the right to peaceful and lawful protest in Hong Kong in the House of Commons on 22nd July ( http://bit.ly/32M0cs7 ).

Regretfully, the coverage of your speech to the House by one of our local media, Television Broadcasts Limited (TVB), seems to be laden with inaccuracies or even misrepresentations.

As shown in the screenshot taken from TVB’s website ( https://na.cx/i/AbxgKYt.jpg ), the news story dated 23rd July takes your statement that ‘We were all shocked to see such unacceptable scenes of violence’ out of context and portrays it as a condemnation of BOTH the clashes between protesters and police outside the Chinese Central Government liaison office AND the armed gang attack on pro-democracy protesters and other passengers at the metro station.

I should be very grateful indeed if you could clarify whether you were minded, when speaking to the House on 22nd July, also to condemn the protests in the vicinity of the Chinese government’s liaison office in the city, quite apart from the ‘unacceptable scenes of violence’ (as you rightly put it) witnessed by many in Yuen Long in abject horror .

Thank you very much for your kind attention. I am looking forward to your reply.
